bool BooleanExpression::ParseFromString ( string  expression  ) 
Parameters:
expression - a new boolean expression in "normal" notation
Returns:
true if the expression could be properly parsed

Clears the current contents of the expression. If the new expression can be parsed, it will be used, otherwise the expression is left empty.

References mArgumentsInReversePolishNotation, mDisplayString, and ParseString().

bool BooleanExpression::ParseString ( string  expression,
bool  isTopLevel 
) [private]
Parameters:
expression - the remaining portion of an expression to be parsed
isTopLevel - if true, indiciates that we are working with the entire boolean expression
Returns:
true if the relevant portion of the expression could be successfully parsed

This function recursively parses an expression. The top level call fails if any characters are left unparsed.
